Gymnastics / Olympic Games

Paris Medals All-time Medals Medal Table Individual Table

MEN

Men´s Olympic Gimnastics consists of eight events: team competition, individual all-around competition, and each of the six apparatuses (horizontal bar, parallel bars, long horse vault, pommeled horse (side horse), rings and floor exercises). The best 36 competitors from the team competition qualify for the individual all-around competition (with a maximun of three gymnasts per nation). The eight best on each apparatus in the team competition (with a maximun of two gymnasts per nation) qualify for the individual final on that apparatus. In Sydney 2000 the trampoline competition was added.

Medal Table (All Events)

* The Men's Olympic Program has remained unchanging since 1936 with the only addition of Trampoline in 2000. Between 1896 and 1932, some "weird" events like rope climbing or club swinging were also held. The discontinued events make a total of 16 (not included in the table below); of which USA won 6 gold medals; GER 2; SWE 2; and SUI, TCH, FRA, GRE, DEN & NOR 1 each. The first edition of the Team Competition (1904) is neither included, as only American teams were allowed to enter.

* Shared medals are considered as two (or three) medals, even when the gymnasts are from the same country.
